issue.title: Implement Tab Management Actions
issue.body:
Add browser tab management capabilities.

**Location:** `src/heimdall/tools/actions.py`, `src/heimdall/browser/session.py`

**Tasks:**
- Add `switch_tab`, `close_tab`, `new_tab` actions
- Track tab state in `BrowserSession`

issue.title: Wire Collector/Export System into Agent Execution
issue.body:
Integrate the collector module into agent execution for step capture and export.

**Location:** `src/heimdall/collector/` → `src/heimdall/cli.py`

**Tasks:**
- Hook collector into agent loop for before/after step capture
- Export results at task completion

issue.title: Implement Functional Demo Mode
issue.body:
Make the demo mode flag functional with visual feedback.

**Location:** `src/heimdall/browser/demo.py`

**Tasks:**
- Pass `demo_mode` flag through CLI to Agent
- Call highlight/tooltip methods before actions

issue.title: Integrate Watchdogs into Agent Loop
issue.body:
Wire existing watchdog implementations into the agent execution loop.

**Location:** `src/heimdall/watchdogs/` → `src/heimdall/agent/loop.py`

**Tasks:**
- Start watchdogs in `Agent.run()`
- Subscribe agent loop to watchdog events
- Use navigation/network events for smarter waiting

payload.description: The all-seeing agent for web automation.
The all-seeing agent for web automation.

issue.title: Set up code formatting and pre-commit hooks
issue.body:
## Description
Missing several helpful code quality tools that would improve developer experience and code consistency.

## Recommended Additions

### 1. Prettier - Code Formatting
- Add .prettierrc config
- Add format script to package.json
- Integrate with editor

### 2. Husky + lint-staged - Pre-commit Hooks
- Run linting on staged files
- Run formatting on staged files
- Prevent bad commits

### 3. commitlint - Conventional Commits
- Enforce commit message format
- Helps with changelog generation

## Benefits
- Consistent code style across the project
- Automated formatting
- Better commit messages
- Reduced code review friction

issue.title: Comprehensive mobile responsiveness testing and improvements
issue.body:
## Description
While the app has a viewport meta tag, there is no evidence of comprehensive mobile testing or responsive design testing.

## Areas to Review
- Terminal interface on mobile devices
- Touch interactions for terminal commands
- Reading experience on small screens
- Navigation on mobile
- Performance on mobile networks

## Recommended Actions
1. Test on actual mobile devices (iOS, Android)
2. Use browser DevTools for responsive testing
3. Optimize touch targets (minimum 44x44px)
4. Consider mobile-specific UI adaptations
5. Test on slow 3G connections

## Benefits
- Better mobile user experience
- Increased mobile traffic and engagement
- Improved mobile SEO rankings

issue.title: Conduct accessibility audit and implement improvements
issue.body:
## Description
No accessibility testing or tooling is currently set up. The retro terminal UI needs to ensure it is accessible to all users.

## Concerns
- Color contrast ratios for different themes
- Keyboard navigation support
- Screen reader compatibility
- ARIA labels and roles
- Focus management

## Recommended Actions
1. Add eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y for static analysis
2. Use axe-core or @axe-core/react for runtime testing
3. Test with screen readers (NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver)
4. Add proper ARIA labels to interactive elements
5. Ensure all functionality is keyboard accessible
6. Test color contrast ratios

## Benefits
- Inclusive design
- Better SEO
- Compliance with accessibility standards (WCAG)

issue.title: Analyze and optimize bundle size
issue.body:
## Description
The node_modules directory is 202MB. While chunking is configured in vite.config.ts, there is no bundle size analysis or monitoring.

## Current State
Manual chunks are defined for React, Markdown, Motion, and Icons.

## Improvements Needed
1. Add bundle analyzer: rollup-plugin-visualizer or vite-bundle-analyzer
2. Analyze and optimize largest chunks
3. Consider lazy loading heavy dependencies (e.g., framer-motion only where needed)
4. Review if all dependencies are actually needed
5. Add bundle size checks in CI

## Benefits
- Faster page loads
- Better performance
- Reduced bandwidth usage
- Improved Core Web Vitals scores

issue.title: Implement Error Boundaries for better error handling
issue.body:
## Description
The React application has no error boundaries implemented. If any component throws an error, the entire application crashes with a white screen of death.

## Impact
- Poor user experience when errors occur
- No graceful degradation
- No error reporting/logging

## Recommended Implementation
1. Create a global error boundary component
2. Add error boundaries around major sections (routes, features)
3. Implement error reporting (e.g., Sentry integration)
4. Show user-friendly error messages

## Benefits
- Better user experience during errors
- Ability to track and fix errors in production
- Application remains partially functional even when errors occur

issue.title: Add TypeScript path aliases for cleaner imports
issue.body:
## Description
The codebase uses relative imports like ../../../components/ui/Footer which become unwieldy in deeply nested files. TypeScript path aliases would improve readability and maintainability.

## Current State
import SEO from '../components/SEO';
import { SITE_CONFIG } from '../config';

## Proposed State
import SEO from '@/components/SEO';
import { SITE_CONFIG } from '@/config';

## Implementation
1. Update tsconfig.app.json with path mappings
2. Update vite.config.ts to resolve aliases
3. Refactor existing imports to use new aliases

## Benefits
- Cleaner, more maintainable imports
- Easier file refactoring
- Better developer experience

issue.title: Update .gitignore with missing common entries
issue.body:
## Description
The current .gitignore is very minimal and missing several common entries that should be excluded from version control.

## Missing Entries
- Build artifacts: *.tsbuildinfo, .vite/
- Editor configs: .vscode/, .idea/, *.swp, *.swo
- OS files: Thumbs.db (Windows)
- Test coverage: coverage/, .nyc_output/
- Logs: *.log, logs/, pnpm-debug.log*, yarn-debug.log*, yarn-error.log*
- Temporary files: .tmp/, temp/

## Priority
Medium - Quick fix, prevents accidentally committing unwanted files

issue.title: Add CI/CD Pipeline with GitHub Actions
issue.body:
## Description
Currently, there are no GitHub Actions workflows defined. This means no automated linting on PRs, no build verification before deployment, and no automated dependency updates.

## Recommended Workflows

### 1. CI Workflow
- Trigger on PRs and pushes to main
- Run npm run lint
- Run npm run build to verify builds
- Check TypeScript compilation

### 2. Dependency Updates
- Use Dependabot or Renovate
- Automatically create PRs for dependency updates

## Benefits
- Catch issues before they reach production
- Automated code quality checks
- Easier dependency management

## Priority
High - Quick win for better code quality

issue.title: Migrate from SPA to SSG architecture
issue.body:
## Overview
Currently, the blog is built as a Single Page Application (SPA), which has limitations for SEO and social media sharing. Meta tags and structured data are not correctly rendered in the static HTML, requiring migration to Static Site Generation (SSG).

## Goals
- Migrate the application from SPA to SSG architecture
- Ensure all blog posts are pre-rendered as static HTML files
- Properly render meta tags (Open Graph, Twitter Cards) in static HTML
- Improve SEO and social media sharing capabilities
- Maintain fast page load times and user experience

## Potential Approaches
1. **Full migration to vite-plugin-ssr or vite-react-ssg**: Complete framework-level SSG support
2. **Custom build script**: Generate static HTML files for each route during build time
3. **Hybrid approach**: Use SSG for blog posts and keep SPA for interactive sections

## Benefits
- Better SEO with pre-rendered content
- Proper meta tags for social media sharing
- Faster initial page load
- Improved Core Web Vitals scores

## Considerations
- Impact on existing routing and navigation
- Build process changes
- Deployment workflow updates
- Client-side interactivity preservation

issue.title: feat(macos-app): add custom namespace UI for cluster isolation
issue.body:
## Overview

Add Advanced Options section with custom namespace field that allows users to override EXO_LIBP2P_NAMESPACE environment variable. This enables splitting machines that can see each other into separate clusters.

- Added customNamespace property with UserDefaults persistence
- Added Advanced Options collapsible section with text field
- Added Save & Restart button that auto-restarts exo process
- Namespace replaces buildTag when custom value is set
- Falls back to buildTag (version) when namespace is empty

## Motivation

EXO supports multiple p2p namespaces to split up clusters via the `EXO_LIBP2P_NAMESPACE` environment variable when building from source. However, when using the macOS app, this was hardcoded to the application version, making it impossible for users to isolate machines into separate clusters without rebuilding the app.

This PR adds a UI option in the macOS app to set a custom namespace, allowing users to split machines that can see each other into multiple logical clusters.

## Changes

- Added `customNamespace` property to [ExoProcessController.swift](cci:7://file:///exo/app/EXO/EXO/ExoProcessController.swift:0:0-0:0) with UserDefaults persistence
- Added "Advanced Options" collapsible section to [ContentView.swift](cci:7://file:///exo/app/EXO/EXO/ContentView.swift:0:0-0:0) (similar to existing Debug Info section)
- Added text field for entering custom namespace with "Save & Restart" button
- Modified `computeNamespace()` to use custom namespace when set, falling back to buildTag (app version) when empty
- Button is disabled when no changes are pending
- Automatically restarts exo process when namespace is saved (if running)

## Why It Works

The implementation modifies the `makeEnvironment()` function to set `EXO_LIBP2P_NAMESPACE` using the custom value from UserDefaults. When the namespace is changed and saved:

1. User enters namespace in text field (value stored in local state)
2. Clicking "Save & Restart" writes to UserDefaults and calls `controller.restart()`
3. On next launch, `computeNamespace()` returns the custom value instead of buildTag
4. This namespace is used when creating the exo process, isolating it from other clusters

## Test Plan

### Manual Testing
**Hardware:** MacBook Air M1 8GB (macOS 26.02)

**What I tested:**
- Verified namespace field appears in Advanced Options section
- Tested entering custom namespace (e.g., "my-cluster")
- Confirmed "Save & Restart" button restarts exo process
- Verified namespace persists across app restarts (UserDefaults)
- Tested empty namespace falls back to buildTag (app version)
- Confirmed button is disabled when no changes pending

### Automated Testing
No automated tests added.

comment.body: Got it, thanks! I can start taking on some issues next year if that works. @Evanev7

## Overview
